title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 § 537.1 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 § 537.1 - Definitions

State Regulations

Social Services Law, §§ 364, 365-a

When used in this Part, unless otherwise expressly stated
or unless the context or subject matter requires a different interpretation, the terms hereinafter set forth shall be interpreted in accordance with the
definitions herein provided. (a) Reimbursement
shall mean State reimbursement. (b) Maximum reimbursable
allowance
shall mean that portion of the expenditure for any
optometric service which shall be subject to reimbursement. (c) Optometric examination
shall include diagnosis for optical deficiency or deformity and the visual or
muscular anomaly of the human eye, by an optometrist. (d) By report
shall mean the
maximum reimbursable allowance determined on an individual basis, in
consideration of the nature, extent and need for the service, the time, skill
and equipment necessary therefor, and such other factor as may be
pertinent. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18
§
537.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
